subject: Re: 答复: [junit] OutOfMemoryError
msgSnippet: This is only temporary solution only, There are three possible causes for an OutOfMemoryError: 1). is that the JVM has a real memory leak, caused by a bug in
messageBody:
This is only temporary solution only,

There are three possible causes for an OutOfMemoryError:
1). is that the JVM has a real memory leak, caused by a bug in the internal implementation of the JVM heap management...
2). is Not enough available heap size...
3). is unintentional object retention...

I guess in No#3 will be in your case as you are using Jtest but not 100% sure.


Regards,
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
M.Madan Mohan Ramarao
VisualSoft Technologies Ltd. Hyderabad, India
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----- Original Message -----
From: Jacky Cheung
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, February 05, 2004 7:09 AM
Subject: Re: 答复: [junit] OutOfMemoryError


OutOfMemoryError means the JVM reached the max heap size. Try to add
-Xmx256m option to increase the max heap size. For more details about
-Xmx option try to type java -X in your command prompt.

汪春燕 wrote:

>May be your JDK version problem,try to use j2sdk1.4.1!!!
>
>
